title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others‚Äô private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement [INSERT CONTACT METHOD]. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla‚Äôs code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Generate a standard load profile
text: call slp_generate(), generate (surprise!) standard load profile. steps performed: Generate date sequence start_date end_date. Map day combination day period. Use result 2nd step extract values slp.3 Apply polynomial function values profile identifier H0. Return data.

title: Generate a standard load profile
text: initial step, date sequence created start_date end_date based user input. ‚Äôs simple example:

what: Map each day to a period and a weekday
title: Generate a standard load profile
text: measured load profiles analyzed study showed electricity consumption across groups fluctuates period year days within week. period definition : summer: May 15 September 14 winter: November 1 March 20 transition: March 21 May 14, September 15 October 31 also found significant difference consumption weekdays Monday Friday group. reason, days Monday Friday grouped together ‚Äòworkdays‚Äô. December 24th 31st considered Saturdays Sundays. Public holidays regarded Sundays. Note: package standardlastprofile supports public holidays Germany. retrieved nager.Date API. nationwide holidays 2024: Jan 1: New Year‚Äôs Mar 29: Good Friday Apr 1: Easter Monday May 1: Labor Day May 9: Ascension Day May 20: Whit Monday Oct 3: German Unity Day Dec 25: Christmas Day Dec 26: Boxing Day optional argument state_code can take one 16 ISO 3166-2:DE codes representing German state. allows consider holidays defined state level . result second step mapping date -called characteristic profile day, .e.¬†combination weekday period:
code: wkday_period <- standardlastprofile:::get_wkday_period(date_seq) data.frame(input = date_seq, output = wkday_period) #>        input          output #> 1 2023-12-22  workday_winter #> 2 2023-12-23 saturday_winter #> 3 2023-12-24   sunday_winter #> 4 2023-12-25   sunday_winter #> 5 2023-12-26   sunday_winter #> 6 2023-12-27  workday_winter

what: Assign consumption values to each day
title: Generate a standard load profile
text: third step assign measurements know slp dataset characteristic profile day. job slp_generate() function: function returns data frame 4 columns: data analysis revealed load fluctuations commercial agricultural customers remain moderate throughout year. Specifically, customers customer groups labeled G0 G6, L0 L2,standard load profile can accurately derived directly 3x3 characteristic profile days available dataset slp. code snippet README, can used reproduce plot G5 profile, showcasing algorithm‚Äôs outcome:  can see, values 2023 December 24 (Sunday) December 25 26 (public holidays) identical.
code: G5 <- slp_generate(   profile_id = "G5",   start_date = "2023-12-22",   end_date = "2023-12-27"   ) head(G5) #>   profile_id          start_time            end_time watts #> 1         G5 2023-12-22 00:00:00 2023-12-22 00:15:00  50.1 #> 2         G5 2023-12-22 00:15:00 2023-12-22 00:30:00  47.4 #> 3         G5 2023-12-22 00:30:00 2023-12-22 00:45:00  44.9 #> 4         G5 2023-12-22 00:45:00 2023-12-22 01:00:00  43.3 #> 5         G5 2023-12-22 01:00:00 2023-12-22 01:15:00  43.0 #> 6         G5 2023-12-22 01:15:00 2023-12-22 01:30:00  43.8 library(ggplot2) ggplot(G5, aes(start_time, watts)) +   geom_line(color = "#0CC792") +   scale_x_datetime(     date_breaks = "1 day",     date_labels = "%b %d") +   labs(     title = "'G5': bakery with bakehouse",     subtitle = "1/4h measurements, based on consumption of 1,000 kWh/a",     caption = "data: www.bdew.de",     x = NULL,     y = "[watts]") +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     panel.grid.minor.x = element_blank(),     panel.grid.minor.y = element_blank(),     panel.grid = element_line(       linetype = "12",       lineend = "round",       colour = "#FAF6F4"       )   ) +   NULL

title: Generate a standard load profile
text: contrast commercial agricultural businesses, relatively even constant electricity consumption throughout year, household electricity consumption decreases winter summer vice versa (least Germany). distinctive annual load profile characteristics household customers, contend customers adequately described static representation using 3x3 characteristic days, done commercial agricultural customers respective periods. Consequently, values provided slp dataset directly comparable representative 1/4h values commercial agricultural profiles. context slp dataset, term ‚Äòstatic‚Äô somewhat inappropriate applied household profiles. values H0 within slp dataset primarily mathematical auxiliary values intended multiplication dynamization factor. taken account call slp_generate(). study suggested application 4th order polynomial function values standard load profile H0. wd=ws√ó(‚àí3.92e‚àí10√ód4+3.20e‚àí7√ód3‚àí7.02e‚àí5√ód2+2.10e‚àí3√ód+1.24) w_d = w_s \times(-3.92\mathrm{e}{-10} \times d^4 + 3.20\mathrm{e}{-7} \times  d^3 - 7.02\mathrm{e}{-5} \times d^2 + 2.10\mathrm{e}{-3} \times d + 1.24)  : wdw_d resulting ‚Äòdynamic‚Äô value wsw_s ‚Äòstatic‚Äô value dd day year integer, starting 1 January 1st following plot shows electrical power develops year profile H0; clearer picture, values aggregated daily level:  multiplication process aims generate representative, dynamic load profile. Finally, following chart compares dynamic values static counterparts.4

what: Data Package for BDEW Standard Load Profiles in Electricity
title: Data Package for BDEW Standard Load Profiles in Electricity
text: package provides data representative, standard load profiles electricity German Association Energy Water Industries (BDEW Bundesverband der Energie- und Wasserwirtschaft e.V.) tidy format.

title: Data Package for BDEW Standard Load Profiles in Electricity
text: can install standardlastprofile CRAN : install development version GitHub use:

title: Data Package for BDEW Standard Load Profiles in Electricity
text: slp ‚Äì dataset containing BDEW standard load profiles electricity. slp_generate() ‚Äì interface generating standard load profile user-defined time period. slp_info() ‚Äì function retrieving details standard load profiles.

title: Data Package for BDEW Standard Load Profiles in Electricity
text: dataset slp result analysis 1,209 load profiles low-voltage electricity consumers Germany, published 1999.1 contains total 9,504 observations across 5 variables: profile_id: identifier standard load profile period: one ‚Äúsummer‚Äù, ‚Äúwinter‚Äù, ‚Äútransition‚Äù day: one ‚Äúworkday‚Äù, ‚Äúsaturday‚Äù, ‚Äúsunday‚Äù timestamp: format ‚Äú%H:%M‚Äù watts: electric power context German electricity market, term ‚ÄòStandard Load Profile‚Äô denotes representative pattern electricity consumption specific period. profiles portray anticipated electricity consumption diverse customer groups, like households businesses. exact match individual customer‚Äôs consumption profile, serve valid approximation larger groups similar customers. unique combination profile_id, period day 96 x 1/4 hour measurements watts. idea H0 means, alone: H0: households (German: ‚ÄúHaushalte‚Äù) G0 G6: commerce (‚ÄúGewerbe‚Äù) L0 L2: agriculture (‚ÄúLandwirtschaft‚Äù) details, call slp_info() function.
code: library(standardlastprofile) str(slp) #> 'data.frame':    9504 obs. of  5 variables: #>  $ profile_id: chr  "H0" "H0" "H0" "H0" ... #>  $ period    : chr  "winter" "winter" "winter" "winter" ... #>  $ day       : chr  "saturday" "saturday" "saturday" "saturday" ... #>  $ timestamp : chr  "00:00" "00:15" "00:30" "00:45" ... #>  $ watts     : num  70.8 68.2 65.9 63.3 59.5 55 50.5 46.6 43.9 42.3 ... slp_info(profile_id = "H0", language = "DE") #> $H0 #> $H0$profile #> [1] "H0" #>  #> $H0$description #> [1] "Haushalt" #>  #> $H0$details #> [1] "In dieses Profil werden alle Haushalte mit ausschlie√ülichem und √ºberwiegendem Privatverbrauch eingeordnet. Haushalte mit √ºberwiegend privatem elektrischen Verbrauch, d.h. auch mit geringf√ºgigem gewerblichen Bedarf sind z.B. Handelsvertreter, Heimarbeiter u.√§. mit B√ºro im Haushalt. Das Profil Haushalt ist nicht anwendbar bei Sonderanwendungen wie z.B. elektrischen Speicherheizungen oder W√§rmepumpen."

title: Standard Load Profile Data for Electricity from BDEW ‚Äî slp
Standard Load Profile Data for Electricity from BDEW ‚Äî slp
text: data.frame 9,504 observations 5 variables: profile_id character, identifier load profile, see 'Details' period character, one 'summer', 'winter', 'transition' day character, one 'saturday', 'sunday', 'workday' timestamp character, format: %H:%M watt numeric, electric power

title: Standard Load Profile Data for Electricity from BDEW ‚Äî slp
text: https://www.bdew.de/energie/standardlastprofile-strom/ https://www.bdew.de/media/documents/Profile.zip https://www.bdew.de/media/documents/1999_Repraesentative-VDEW-Lastprofile.pdf

title: Standard Load Profile Data for Electricity from BDEW ‚Äî slp
text: 96 x 1/4h measurements electrical power combination profile_id, period day, refer "standard load profile". dataset results analysis 1,209 load profiles low-voltage electricity consumers Germany, published 1999. total 11 profile_id three different customer groups: Households: H0 Commercial: G0, G1, G2, G3, G4, G5, G6 Agriculture: L0, L1, L2 Call slp_info() information examples. Period definitions: summer: May 15 September 14 winter: November 1 March 20 transition: March 21 May 14, September 15 October 31 Day definitions: workday: Monday Friday saturday: Saturdays; Dec 24th Dec 31th considered Saturdays Sunday sunday: Sundays public holidays

title: Standard Load Profile Data for Electricity from BDEW ‚Äî slp
code: head(slp) #>   profile_id period      day timestamp watts #> 1         H0 winter saturday     00:00  70.8 #> 2         H0 winter saturday     00:15  68.2 #> 3         H0 winter saturday     00:30  65.9 #> 4         H0 winter saturday     00:45  63.3 #> 5         H0 winter saturday     01:00  59.5 #> 6         H0 winter saturday     01:15  55.0

what: Generate a Standard Load Profile ‚Äî slp_generate
title: Generate a Standard Load Profile ‚Äî slp_generate
text: Generate standard load profile, normalized annual consumption 1,000 kWh.

title: Generate a Standard Load Profile ‚Äî slp_generate
Generate a Standard Load Profile ‚Äî slp_generate
text: https://www.bdew.de/energie/standardlastprofile-strom/ https://www.bdew.de/media/documents/1999_Repraesentative-VDEW-Lastprofile.pdf https://www.bdew.de/media/documents/2000131_Anwendung-repraesentativen_Lastprofile-Step--step.pdf

title: Generate a Standard Load Profile ‚Äî slp_generate
text: profile_id load profile identifier, required start_date start date ISO 8601 format, required end_date end date ISO 8601 format, required state_code identifier one 16 German states, optional

title: Generate a Standard Load Profile ‚Äî slp_generate
text: data.frame four variables: profile_id, character, load profile identifier start_time, POSIXct / POSIXlt, start time end_time, POSIXct / POSIXlt, end time watts, numeric, electric power

title: Generate a Standard Load Profile ‚Äî slp_generate
text: regards electricity market Germany, term "Standard Load Profile" refers representative pattern electricity consumption specific period. profiles can used depict expected electricity consumption various customer groups, households businesses. distinct combination profile_id, period, day, 96 x 1/4 hour measurements electrical power. Values normalized correspond annual consumption 1,000 kWh. , summing quarter-hourly consumption values one year yields approximate total 1,000 kWh/; information, refer 'Examples' section, call vignette("algorithm-step--step"). total 11 profile_id three different customer groups: Households: H0 Commercial: G0, G1, G2, G3, G4, G5, G6 Agriculture: L0, L1, L2 information examples, call slp_info(). Period definitions: summer: May 15 September 14 winter: November 1 March 20 transition: March 21 May 14, September 15 October 31 Day definitions: workday: Monday Friday saturday: Saturdays; Dec 24th Dec 31th considered Saturdays Sunday sunday: Sundays public holidays Note: package supports public holidays Germany, retrieved nager.Date API. Use optional argument state_code consider public holidays state level . Allowed values listed : DE-BB: Brandenburg DE-: Berlin DE-BW: Baden-W√ºrttemberg DE-: Bavaria DE-HB: Bremen DE-: Hesse DE-HH: Hamburg DE-MV: Mecklenburg-Vorpommern DE-NI: Lower-Saxony DE-NW: North Rhine-Westphalia DE-RP: Rhineland-Palatinate DE-SH: Schleswig-Holstein DE-SL: Saarland DE-SN: Saxony DE-ST: Saxony-Anhalt DE-TH: Thuringia start_date must greater equal "1990-01-01". public holidays Germany ambitious reunification 1990 (think state Berlin 1989 earlier). end_date must smaller equal "2073-12-31" last year supported nager.Date API.

title: Generate a Standard Load Profile ‚Äî slp_generate
code: start <- "2024-01-01" end <- "2024-12-31"  # multiple profile IDs are supported L <- slp_generate(c("L0", "L1", "L2"), start, end) head(L) #>   profile_id          start_time            end_time watts #> 1         L0 2024-01-01 00:00:00 2024-01-01 00:15:00  68.3 #> 2         L0 2024-01-01 00:15:00 2024-01-01 00:30:00  66.0 #> 3         L0 2024-01-01 00:30:00 2024-01-01 00:45:00  64.3 #> 4         L0 2024-01-01 00:45:00 2024-01-01 01:00:00  63.0 #> 5         L0 2024-01-01 01:00:00 2024-01-01 01:15:00  62.1 #> 6         L0 2024-01-01 01:15:00 2024-01-01 01:30:00  61.4  # you can specify one of the 16 ISO 3166-2:DE codes to take into # account holidays determined at the level of the federal states berlin <- slp_generate("H0", start, end, state_code = "DE-BE")  # for convenience, the codes can be specified without the prefix "DE-" identical(berlin, slp_generate("H0", start, end, state_code = "BE")) #> [1] TRUE  # state codes are not case-sensitive identical(berlin, slp_generate("H0", start, end, state_code = "de-be")) #> [1] TRUE  # consider only nationwide public holidays H0_2024 <- slp_generate("H0", start, end)  # electric power values are normalized to consumption of ~1,000 kWh/a sum(H0_2024$watts / 4 / 1000) #> [1] 1002.084

title: Retrieve information on standard load profiles ‚Äî slp_info
text: profile_id load profile identifier, required language one 'EN' (English), 'DE' (German)

title: Retrieve information on standard load profiles ‚Äî slp_info
text: list

title: Retrieve information on standard load profiles ‚Äî slp_info
code: slp_info("G5", language = "DE") #> $G5 #> $G5$profile #> [1] "G5" #>  #> $G5$description #> [1] "B√§ckerei mit Backstube" #>  #> $G5$details #> [1] "B√§ckereien mit Backstube haben den Schwerpunkt ihres Verbrauchs an den Werktagen traditionell ab ca. 3 Uhr fr√ºh und in der Nacht zum Samstag ab etwa Mitternacht. Der Tagverbrauch ist zum Gesamtbedarf relativ gering und wird haupts√§chlich von der Verkaufst√§tigkeit bestimmt. Verkaufsorientierte B√§ckereien, in denen zu Gesch√§ftszeiten Backwaren zubereitet werden ('Backen im Laden'), verhalten sich wie andere L√§den und sind im Profil G4 einzuordnen." #>  #>   # multiple profile IDs are supported slp_info(c("G0", "G5")) #> $G0 #> $G0$profile #> [1] "G0" #>  #> $G0$description #> [1] "commerce in general" #>  #> $G0$details #> [1] "If an assignment to one of the profiles G1 to G6 is not possible or desired, this profile represents the weighted average of the overall group." #>  #>  #> $G5 #> $G5$profile #> [1] "G5" #>  #> $G5$description #> [1] "bakery with bakehouse" #>  #> $G5$details #> [1] "Bakeries with a bakery traditionally have their main consumption on weekdays from around 3 a.m. and on Saturday nights from around midnight. Daytime consumption is relatively low compared to overall demand and is mainly determined by sales activities. Sales-oriented bakeries in which bakery products are prepared during business hours ('in-store baking') behave like other stores and are classified in profile G4." #>  #>

what: standardlastprofile: Data Package for BDEW Standard Load Profiles in Electricity ‚Äî standardlastprofile-package
title: standardlastprofile: Data Package for BDEW Standard Load Profiles in Electricity ‚Äî standardlastprofile-package
text: Data standard load profiles German Association Energy Water Industries (BDEW Bundesverband der Energie- und Wasserwirtschaft e.V.) tidy format. data methodology described VDEW (1999), "Repr√§sentative VDEW-Lastprofile", https://www.bdew.de/media/documents/1999_Repraesentative-VDEW-Lastprofile.pdf. package also offers interface generating standard load profile user-defined period. algorithm, see VDEW (2000), "Anwendung der Repr√§sentativen VDEW-Lastprofile step--step", https://www.bdew.de/media/documents/2000131_Anwendung-repraesentativen_Lastprofile-Step--step.pdf.

title: standardlastprofile: Data Package for BDEW Standard Load Profiles in Electricity ‚Äî standardlastprofile-package
